summary: A small fertile cavern ready for alchemists to build a little hideaway.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff7700][center][size=5][b][u]This mod is no longer being supported and should be taken as it is. I will not be returning to this page to assist users and will ignore any personal messages regarding this mod. The fact that this mod is no longer supported does NOT give anyone the right to re-publish my work with or without credit. The rules regarding asset use still apply however the answer to all requests for permission to use my assets contained within this mod should be assumed to be NO.[/u][/b][/size][/center][/color]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/F0gziKk.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/tQ6xa5b.png[/img]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/d20xLnW.png[/img]

A small fertile cavern ready for alchemists to build a little hideaway. The location of the cavern is near Falkreath. The facilities within the cavern are built by the player except for a starting tent and bed.

[img]http://i.imgur.com/Q56lZo9.png[/img]

- Build it yourself
- Hearthfire Style Garden (up to 105 plots)
- Mill
- Apiary
- Fishery
- Standard forge, alchemy and enchanting facilities

[img]http://i.imgur.com/5MWYShC.png[/img]

All Skyrim DLC (Dawnguard, Dragonborn and Hearthfire)

[img]http://i.imgur.com/t64w1Mc.png[/img]

[b]NMM:[/b] 
- Standard insallation method

NOTE: Installation via NMM should work by the default install process however I offer no support for it in case it doesn't.

[b]Manual:[/b]
1 - Download the archive and extract the contents to a specific location
2 - Copy or move the files extracted to the Skyrim "Data" folder
3 - Run the Skyrim launcher and ensure that "LrsamwaysFertileCavern.esp" is ticked

[img]http://i.imgur.com/sWRNZkd.png[/img]

None at this stage

[img]http://i.imgur.com/v4xPYBZ.png[/img]

Pinetree Lodge - Incompatible
Pinewood Manor - Incompatible

[img]http://i.imgur.com/s1j2NN2.png[/img]

V1:
- Initial release

[img]http://i.imgur.com/MZCAac8.png[/img]

[b]- Q: "[/b]Can all my followers stay here?[b]"
- A:[/b] No.

[b]- Q: "[/b]Where is it?[b]"
- A: [/b]There is adequate information in the images to show you where it is.

[b]- Q: "[/b]Why is the entrance blocked?[b]"
- A: [/b]You first need to go to the Dwarven Storeroom of Mzulft to obtain Explosive Powder to remove the blockage that has killed Jimmy and blocked entry to the cavern.

- [b]Q[/b]: "How do i get logs?"
- [b]A[/b]: You first need to own a standard Hearthfire plot before you can cut them yourself or purchase them from a lumber mill owner e.g. Hod in Riverwood. Sawn logs are shared and as such all logs purchased for normal Hearthfire homes will be available for use in the cavern as well.

- [b]Q: "[/b]In relation to the above reply, why do i need to buy a plot of land in order to purchase logs?"[b]
[/b]- [b]A: [/b]Because modifying the dialogue to allow the purchase of logs at any point in time, even before owning a plot may cause a lot of issues and conflicts with other mods. I make my own things or use a duplicate instance of existing things and only modify existing game attributes where absolutely necessary. 

[img]http://i.imgur.com/EGfPwd2.png[/img]

- The use of LrsamwaysFertileCavern.esp or LrsamwaysFertileCavern.bsa and any subset assets is strictly forbidden
- Feel free to translate and/or modify the mod for your personal use
[b]
[/b][u][b]Under no circumstances are my mods to be uploaded to sites other than the nexus[/b][/u]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/JiA8q2g.png[/img]

Bethesda for Skyrim and the Creation Kit
author: Lrsamways
